chore(cleanup): project cleanup and professional OSS organization

## What Changed
- **Deleted outdated artifacts**: Removed podge/ directory (5 old design files), tests/ (empty), file (empty), IMPLEMENTATION_PLAN.md
- **Deleted old documentation**: Removed 5 outdated docs/ files (HOD-11-implementation-report.md, PM_INTEGRATION.md, STANDARDS.md, epic-story-breakdown.md, local-testing.md, pre-push-hooks.md)
- **Rebranded package**: Changed from @agile-explorations/hodge to @hodgeson/hodge in package.json
- **Updated repository**: Changed GitHub org to hodgeson-dev/hodge, set homepage to www.hodgeson.dev
- **Added professional OSS files**: 
  - CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md (Contributor Covenant 2.1)
  - SECURITY.md (vulnerability reporting policy)
- **Created new documentation structure**:
  - docs/getting-started.md (installation and first feature guide)
  - docs/basic-usage.md (common workflows and slash commands)
  - docs/advanced/README.md (placeholder for advanced topics)
  - examples/README.md (placeholder for sample projects)
  - scripts/README.md (documents all 22 scripts)
- **Updated README.md**: Professional structure with badges (build status, npm version, license)
- **Updated .gitignore**: Added .hodge/review-profiles/ and report/ patterns
- **Updated .eslintignore**: Added *.md and *.json exclusions to prevent false positives
- **Fixed pre-existing test failures**: Corrected build.md template (removed duplicate bell icon from HODGE-346.2)
- **Updated CHANGELOG.md**: Documented rebranding and cleanup
- **Updated CONTRIBUTING.md**: Changed repository references to new org
- **Added comprehensive smoke tests**: 10 tests in src/test/hodge-352.smoke.test.ts verifying cleanup requirements

## Why This Change
The project contained several outdated directories, duplicate structures, and missing professional OSS elements that made it feel less polished than it should be for public release. This comprehensive cleanup prepares Hodge for publication as a professional open source project under the new @hodgeson brand.
